problem: Car A has a mass of 1,200 kg moving at 15 m/s, and Car B has a mass of 800 kg moving at -10 m/s. Calculate the total momentum of the system before the collision.
Two billiard balls collide elastically. Ball 1 has a mass of 0.2 kg and is moving at 3 m/s, while Ball 2 is at rest. Calculate the total momentum of the two balls before the collision.

In a perfectly inelastic collision, Car A (1,200 kg) and Car B (800 kg) collide and stick together. If their total initial momentum is 10,000 kg·m/s, what will be their final combined velocity after the collision?
